result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank J Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharges within 3 years or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
- Restitution set at zero.

- AODA/any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Defendant may not possess any weapons.
- No new OWI arrests.

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by April 19, 2018, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 99 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank J Lowe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frank J Lowe in court with attorney Arial J. Rosenberg.  Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 99 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by April 19, 2018, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept. 
Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
( x ) sentence after revocation
Order DENYING defendant's request for additional release privileges, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for additional release privileges.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for two years, to commence after the completion of count one sentence,  with the following conditions:
*aoda/ any treatment deemed appropriate
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges within 3 years or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant
*defendant may not possess any weapons
*no new OWI arrests
*provide a DNA sample
*court set restitution at zero 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Frank J Lowe in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State withdraws the Amended Complaint. 

AS TO COUNTS ONE AND THREE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING. 

AS TO COUNT ONE:  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 10 MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 12 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court objects to ES . SENTENCE TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH. 

Fine of $2400.00 plus all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges  to be paid from bail on deposit and balance by 3-28-16    or  Civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and tax intercept.

Couurt ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for three years with the mandatory reinstatement fee. 

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming. 

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  two years  thereafter.
State filed amended complaint;amended jury instructions; amended motion in limine.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
